date: stated on August 28, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: The anti-duck reaction, but you may not hear it.
text: If the duck quacks in the woods and no one's around to hear it, does it resonate? Not according to Facebook August 28, which claims that "the duck's quacks don't hesitate and no one can know why." But animal realities on the Internet should be read with some doubt even if they come from a page called itself known. This article was specifically referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misinformation in Newsfe. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) That's because a duck quack resonates, although it's hard to hear. Trevor Cox, a professor of sound engineering at the University of Salvard, Manchester, investigated the myth that a duck quack did not resonate when he heard from journalists asking him whether that was true, according to a story published by the Guardian newspaper in 2003. The distinguished fact-finding bloggers mentioned on January 10, 2021 in the story of "The Rebel Law - General Flynn will be appointed Vice-President." Cox said that he believed that the forbidden legend stemmed from the fact that the duck's quack was relatively quiet and that his resonance was unheard of.
